intro: Greeneocharis circumscissa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically features compact, mat-forming growth with small, fleshy, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its succulent leaves and flowering structure are adaptations to conserve water in harsh environments. Greeneocharis circumscissa is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of xerophytic plant communities.
